description:
We help construction companies to improve safety measures, quantify labor productivity, and automate workforce logistics. 

WakeCap comprises an innovative harness that works seamlessly with a construction hardhat without compromising the structural integrity of the helmet, non-GPS network that connects your worksite securely and scale up with your project, dashboard monitoring system that easily integrates into your existing applications and project management software.
description_enriched: WakeCap Technologies is an IoT-based construction workforce management solution designed to provide comprehensive site visibility, facilitate the monitoring of safety compliance, and enhance workforce productivity through real-time resource allocation and tracking, and present the information on the construction industry.

In this episode, Hassan Albalawi, PhD, Founder of WakeCap, shares the story behind building a groundbreaking safety and productivity platform for the construction industry. From a simple idea to a global solution now connecting more than 200,000 workers worldwide, WakeCap is transforming how sites are managed.

Highlights from the conversation:

- How a PhD project in drowsiness detection evolved into a construction technology startup.
- The challenges of creating a no-training, privacy-first wearable integrated into hard hats.
 -Why leading companies like aramco are adopting WakeCap to enhance site safety and efficiency.
- The future of construction technologyâ€”linking sensors, planning, and even robotics.
- WakeCapâ€™s vision for scaling from Saudi Arabiaâ€™s $2 trillion projects to global markets.

Donâ€™t miss this deep dive into the future of construction safety, productivity, and digital transformation.

From a single breakthrough idea to a powerful ecosystem of intelligent site solutions, WakeCap has grownâ€”and so has our brand.

Hassan Albalawi, CEO of WakeCap, was invited to speak at the 9th Biennial Conference on Construction Projects from Conception to Completion, held from 27â€“29 March 2025 at the Excelsior Hotel Gallia, Milan, Italy.

Presented by the IBA International Construction Projects Committee, the conference brought together international leaders from across the legal and construction sectors to explore the latest developments in project delivery, dispute resolution, and technology adoption.

Hassan joined a panel on "The New Technologies in Construction Projects"â€”a timely discussion focused on how emerging tech can enhance project management, site safety, and even reduce the potential for claims and disputes.

Drawing from real-world insights, Hassan showcased how WakeCapâ€™s solutions are transforming site visibility, improving worker safety, and delivering measurable performance across mega-projects in the Middle East.
